title: Lead Talent Acquisition
content:
Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media. We are a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries.
We promote diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment to enable all employees to feel valued and respected, which fosters creativity and innovation by allowing constructive collaboration and open exchange of ideas.Our organization gives the possibility to work remotely part of the time and more flexibility is open to discussion. We also offer relocation packages if you prefer to settle down in one of our engineering offices.
To support our development, we are looking for a Global Lead in Talent Acquisition to integrate our global excellence HR Team. 
 Our Recruitment Team 
Teads Recruitment team is composed of 7 peoples distributed between 3 continents, Europe, North America & Asia. This team operates for the whole group to provide quality recruitment strategies & support our 30 countries. As Lead Talent Acquisition your missions will be to define & implement globally Teads Recruitment strategies by partnering with local Talent Acquisition team members. To define, monitor and analyze KPIs regarding recruitment performance. To scale recruitment excellence through training, automation of workflow, choices of tools etc. 
The overall objective is to respond effectively and proactively to Teads Talent demand needs in the short, medium and long term.You will report to the Teads Chief People Officer and work closely local HR Directors. 
 What will you do? 

Talent Acquisition : 

Lead a high-performing Global Talent Acquisition team.
Develop, lead and implement successful Talent Acquisition strategies.
Leading, shaping and elevating the TA strategy to attract, develop and recruit talents.
Build and run long term talents pools strategies.
Assess, improve & monitor our candidate experience.
Engage and inspire the Talent Acquisition team by providing excellent leadership and direction to continue to advance the functions.   Be a role model, a strong mentor/coach, and functional expert.
Develop, implement and measure Talent Acquisition strategies for different departments.
Successfully deliver hiring objectives relatives to the organization’s vision, long term strategy and annual goals.
Partnership with Leadership teams, VP’s , HRBP etc..
Influence business decisions with workforce planning and talent needs.




Recruitment operations :

Definition and setup of KPIs to measure and improve the performance of the TA team.
Leverage analytics and tools available to develop and deliver world-class Talent Acquisition standards of excellence, set standards, and measure results.
Training of the TA team on data analytics usage.
Solve problems and keep the TA engine room running globally across Teads.
Supporting the Talent Acquisition team & wider business in improving our recruitment performance by providing & scaling training programs, Hiring Process, recruitment guidelines, TA tools etc..)
Assessment, on-boarding and scaling of news & impactful TA tools.
Partner with key stakeholders to enable the advancement of global scale of recruitment optimization.
Collaborating across Teads to align, scale and promote good practices to recruiters, Hiring Managers & interviewers. 




Employer Branding :

Partnership with local TA to deploy & scale global employer branding strategy locally.
Responsible for Career website, glassdoor & linkedin communication alignment (Communication, Job Description etc..) 



 
What will you bring to the team?

8-10 years of experience in Talent Acquisition with at least 5 years in Software Engineering field with leadership expertise.
Experience leading distributed Talent Acquisition teams, demonstrated ability to lead, mentor and develop a high performing Talent Acquisition Team.
Strong project management skills across projects of varying size and scope
Strong ability to use data and metrics to assess recruiting effectiveness.
Analytical and problem solving skills, for data driven decision making. 
Comfort with public speaking across all audiences
Excellent writing and communication skills
Fluent in English
This role is located in Paris or Montpellier.  


Why work at Teads? 


Security & Savings: Attractive package providing financial peace of mind, including competitive compensation,
Career Development: Continuous investment in our employees' skills: in-house and external training, conference opportunities, internal mobility (individual contributor or management career ladder).
Wellness: Prioritizing employee well-being through premium work equipment, enjoyable work environment (work-life balance, team building events, summits), remote work subsidy. Promoting Diversity & Inclusion with internal & external initiatives (women speaking groups, dedicated school partnerships), dedicated charitable time and sustainability actions (Eco Tree, subsidy for eco-mobility).
Life Balance: A well-balanced work-life for our employees is one of our top priorities.  

 
About Teads 
Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media.
As an end-to-end solution, Teads’ modular platform allows partners to leverage buy-side, sell-side, creative, data and AI optimization technologies. For advertisers and their agencies, Teads offers a single access point to buy the inventory of many of the world’s best publishers and content providers.
Through exclusive global media partnerships, Teads enables advertisers and agencies to reach billions of unique monthly users in brand safe, responsible advertising environments, while improving the effectiveness and efficiency of digital ad transactions.
Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries.
We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.
